Metadata.title: World Lab Ranking - Find Your Perfect Research Lab
Metadata.description: Explore and compare top research labs worldwide based on their publications and impact in computer science. Make informed decisions about your research career.

Landing.title: Find Your Perfect Research Lab
Landing.description: Explore and compare top research labs worldwide based on their publications and impact in different fields of computer science.
Landing.cs_ranking_description: Comprehensive rankings of computer science research labs based on conference publications and citations.

features.feature1: Rankings based on top-tier conference publications
features.feature2: Detailed analysis of research impact by field

Landing.future_fields_description: We're working on expanding our coverage to more academic fields.
Landing.faq_description: Get answers to common questions about our research lab rankings

faqs.a1: Our rankings are based on publications in top-tier conferences, citation impact, and research output quality. We analyze data from multiple sources to provide comprehensive evaluations.
faqs.a2: Rankings are updated regularly to reflect the latest conference publications and research achievements. We ensure our data stays current with academic developments.
faqs.q3: Can I suggest a lab to be included?
faqs.a3: Yes! We welcome suggestions for new labs to include in our rankings. Contact us with the lab's details and publication history.
faqs.q4: How can I use these rankings?
faqs.a4: Use our rankings to compare research labs, find potential graduate schools, identify collaboration opportunities, and make informed decisions about your academic career.

Footer.copyright: Â© 2024 World Lab Ranking. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy - World Lab Ranking
metadata.description: Privacy Policy for World Lab Ranking - Learn how we handle and protect research data and user information

dataCollection.title: Data Collection and Research Information
dataCollection.content: We collect and process information through automated crawling agents and manual submissions. Here's what we collect:

items.research: Public research data from universities and laboratories
items.personal: Basic user information (email, name) when provided

dataAccuracy.title: Data Accuracy and Limitations
dataAccuracy.content: While we strive for accuracy in our data collection and ranking calculations, we acknowledge certain limitations:

items.coverage: Our automated crawling may not cover all institutions due to technical limitations
items.security: Some information may be incomplete due to institutional security measures
items.updates: Data is updated regularly but may not reflect real-time changes
items.interpretation: Rankings should be considered as reference points rather than absolute measures

dataUse.title: How We Use Information
dataUse.content: We use the collected information to:

items.ranking: Generate and maintain research lab rankings
items.analysis: Provide insights into research trends and performance
items.communication: Facilitate communication within the research community

dataSecurity.title: Data Protection and Privacy
dataSecurity.content: We prioritize the protection of sensitive information and maintain strict privacy standards:

items.protection: Individual researcher information is kept confidential
items.aggregation: Only aggregated and non-sensitive data is publicly displayed
items.security: We implement robust security measures to protect all collected data

dataSubmission.title: Data Submission and Corrections
dataSubmission.content: Users can submit additional information or request corrections to ensure data accuracy. We verify all submissions before inclusion.

cookies.title: Use of Cookies
cookies.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance user experience and service functionality. Users can control cookie settings through their browsers.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Access
thirdParty.content: We do not share individual researcher or sensitive institutional data with third parties. Only publicly available aggregated data may be shared for research purposes.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: For questions about our privacy practices or to submit data corrections, please contact us at:

metadata.title: Terms of Service - World Lab Ranking
metadata.description: Terms of Service for World Lab Ranking - Understanding our service principles and user guidelines

acceptance.title: Agreement to Terms
acceptance.content: By using World Lab Ranking, you acknowledge and agree to these terms, including our data collection and ranking methodologies.

services.title: Service Description
services.content: World Lab Ranking provides data-driven insights into global research institutions, aiming to:

items.objective: Provide objective and fair information for graduate school aspirants
items.trends: Track and analyze global research trends and achievements
items.community: Foster collaboration within the research community

dataAccuracy.title: Data Accuracy Disclaimer
dataAccuracy.content: While we strive for accuracy, users should note:

items.limitations: Rankings may have inherent limitations due to data collection constraints
items.completeness: Not all institutions may be fully represented due to technical limitations
items.interpretation: Rankings should be used as reference points rather than absolute measures
items.updates: Data is updated regularly but may not reflect immediate changes

items.access: Access and use publicly available ranking information
items.submit: Submit additional data or correction requests

prohibited.title: Prohibited Activities
prohibited.content: The following activities are strictly prohibited:

items.harmful: Using the service to harm institutions or individuals

changes.title: Service Changes
changes.content: We may update our services, ranking methodologies, and these terms to improve accuracy and user experience. Users will be notified of significant changes.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer of Warranty
disclaimer.content: While we strive for accuracy and completeness, our services are provided 'as is' without any warranties regarding the completeness or accuracy of rankings.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: For questions about these terms or to report issues, please contact us at:

gpa_calculator.title: GPA Calculator
gpa_calculator.description: Convert your grades from any country's grading system to the US 4.0 GPA scale. Simply select your country, choose your institution's grading system, add your courses, and see your converted GPA instantly.
gpa_calculator.no_grading_systems_available: No grading systems available for this country

explanation.title: How GPA is Calculated
explanation.intro: This calculator helps you convert grades from any country's grading system to the US 4.0 GPA scale, which is widely used by American universities for academic assessment.
explanation.step1: First, your grades are converted to US equivalent grades, then to GPA points using this standard scale:
explanation.step2: Each course's GPA points are multiplied by its credits (or hours).
explanation.step2_example: For example: If you got an A (4.0) in a 3-credit course, that's 12 points (4.0 Ã 3 = 12).
explanation.step3: Finally, all points are added up and divided by the total number of credits to get your GPA.
explanation.note1: Most undergraduate programs require a minimum GPA of 2.0 (C average).
explanation.note2: Graduate programs typically require a minimum GPA of 3.0 (B average).
explanation.note3: While D is technically a passing grade in some institutions, many programs won't accept credits with grades below C.
